body.name: SanDisk Cruzer Blade 8GB USB 2.0 Flash Drive- SDCZ50-008G-B35
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Share your photos, videos, songs and other files between computers with ease

Protect your private files with included SanDisk SecureAccess software (Password protection uses 128-bit AES encryption and is supported by Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10 and Mac OS X v10.6+ (Software download required for Mac, see official SanDisk Secure Access website for more details.))
Store more with capacities up to 8GB (1 gigabyte (GB) = 1 billion bytes. Some capacity not available for data storage.)
body.description: Take your favorite files with you on the ultra-compact and portable Cruzer Blade USB flash drive. Just pop your pictures, music or other fun files onto the sleek SanDisk Cruzer Blade USB flash drive and start sharing with your family and friends the small, swift way. You can also protect files on your USB flash drive from unauthorized access with the included SanDisk SecureAccess software. (Password protection uses 128-bit AES encryption and is supported by Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10 and Mac OS X v10.6+ (Software download required for Mac, see official SanDisk Secure Access website for more details.))

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Carry and Keep your Favourite Files With the ultra-compact and portable SanDisk Cruzer Blade USB flash Drive, you can take your files with you wherever you go.
Sharing Just Got Simple With the Cruzer Blade USB Flash Drive you can easily transfer up to 128 GB* worth of videos, music, photos and more to share with your family and friends.

SanDisk Cruzer Blade USB Flash Drive 8 GB SanDisk Cruzer Blade USB Flash Drive 16 GB SanDisk Cruzer Blade USB Flash Drive 32 GB SanDisk Cruzer Blade USB Flash Drive 64 GB SanDisk Cruzer Blade USB Flash Drive 128 GB Photo (10 MP)** 450 photos 900 photos 1800 photos 3600 photos 7200 photos Video (1080 AVCHD) 20 mins 40 mins 80 mins 160 mins 320 mins Music (MP3 songs) 500 songs 1000 songs 2000 songs 4000 songs 8000 songs Office Files 2 GB 4 GB 8 GB 16 GB 32 GB

Disclaimers * 1 GB = 1,000,000,000 bytes. Actual user storage less. ** Approximations: results will vary based on file size, resolution, compression, bit rate, content, host device, pre-loaded files and other factors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keep It On a Lanyard
reviews.reviewText: I should like to preface this review by noting that I purchased this for the express purpose of flashing my PC motherboard's BIOS and it worked splendidly in doing so. Its capabilities all fall within what is to be expected of a 2,0 USB. I have not performed any thorough tests in regards to the speed of this drive and I think that that would be superfluous anyways. It is not a 3,0 USB and thus one should not expect 3,0 speeds.It should however be noted that this drive is unusually small; the term "thumb drive" seems to have been taken literally by SanDisk as this is only about as large as half of the size of the average adult thumb—something to bear in mind when storing this drive as one might imagine how easy it would be to lose it.In closing, if you are in need of a 2,0 drive for the purpose of updating your motherboard's BIOS then this shall do quite nicely. This might also do well for a student in need of cheap, transportable storage for school assignments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great on a Bernina 7 series!
reviews.reviewText: Hello there,There isn't much to say about an 8 GB USB pen drive you don't already know. But if you are a Bernina user, you may wonder if this model would work well with a Bernina.Short answer: Yes. I was looking for a brand-name USB thumb drive for our sewing machine and our embroiderer, and these worked great out of the box. Berninas seems to have problems going over 8GB, but they work perfectly with these 8GB ones. Make sure your format is FAT32, and you are ready!They were tested on a Bernina 700e, 770QE Kaffee edition, and Bernette B70. They should work with other modern series like the 4, 5, or 8.Thank you for reading!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SanDisk Cruzer Blade's #1 fan in the whole wide world.
reviews.reviewText: I've been using Cruzer Blades for years. I keep buying larger and larger ones as they become available. It's rugged because there's no moving parts. There's no retractable useless mechanism to lock, no stupid dust cap to lose because it's not included, and those don't matter anyway. You don't need a dust cap, stop it. They're smaller than the majority of other flash drives. They're perfectly contoured and shaped to fit firmly between your thumb and index finger so that they're extremely comfortable and easy to insert. When you push them in, they go in. When you pull them out, they come out. You'll be at least 50% less likely to insert them upside-down, and they just work.I use them for everything. It's the best USB stick I've ever had attached to a keychain with 2 huge truck keys, 4 other car keys, 3 tool box keys, 4 work keys, and 5 house keys as well as some rappelling gear. Years like this. I work every day, and my keys are always with me. They get banged around, have been inserted and ejected into dozens if not hundreds of Macs and PCs at home and at work and have never failed. I still have and use every one of them I've ever bought, and in every storage capacity available since they were first produced.They have hundreds of uses. Game storage, backups, installer media, bootable operating systems, automobile service records, presentations, desktop, documents, downloads, library, movies, music, pictures, sites, shared. All of the software I need to do my job, right there on the keychain. PDF service manuals for the equipment I repair go with me everywhere. I guess you could put stupid stuff like homework, or passwords on it, but I don't because those things aren't fun. It's more fun to plug your whole music library into one of the USB slots on your brand new, shiny, technology-packed, voice-activated 6.1 digital surround sound equipped loaded premium model 4x4 truck and tell your truck what you want to hear. It's safer, too. For you and everybody else. Of course the truck is optional, but if your vehicle is equipped with these technologies, please do this. You'll never be the distracted one. The Cruzer Blade is perfect for this in the hot summer and in the cold of winter. I know this for a fact. Years like this. Always available. It will even let you use your phone storage for more useful and practical things, or it could even allow you to buy the smaller, less expensive, less storage capacity model of the same phone saving you hundreds of dollars. If you wanted to listen to music on the go, everything everywhere has USB, and it's all louder and sounds better than your phone. Go out to your truck and get it. Problem solved. Phone stays charged.Pros: If you need a RED and BLACK, tough, simple, durable, stealthy USB 2.0 flash drive, then this is the best one ever made. Indisputable champion.Cons: The form factor hasn't changed over the years, WHICH IS FANTASTIC! Don't change them in any physical or functional way... but the microscopic painted lettering eventually wears away on both sides, so you don't know if it's a 16 GB, 32 GB, 64 GB or 128 GB? You just know that it's the red and black one. I wish like crazy these things came in a dozen different colors. Maybe even get creative and make one that glows in the dark? Or polished Aluminum? Woodgrain? Tortoise shell? Burl? Clear? Of course I have nothing against red and black... I'm just sayin... it's the only way it could be improved, I don't know that any of this qualifies as a con? I have zero complaints with the quality of this product and my experience with using them. I'm sorry if I hurt your feelings, red and black. Long live the red and black Cruzer Blade USB 2.0 flash drives!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars USB 2.0 flash drive
reviews.reviewText: The USB 2.0 flash drive was recommended for my new Roku TV in order to use their Live TV Pause feature. I have other Roku TV's around and when I added a USB 3.0 flash drive after a few days they developed problems. I switched them to 2.0 and the problems disappeared. This one was the right size (16GB) and the price was fine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Work great with older and newer devices
reviews.reviewText: Work great for older and newer devices. I had a DVR box and USB flash drive worked great with it. I had no problems with it and recommend it.

reviews.reviewerName: Muito bom, chegou em ótimo estado, lacrado e bem cuidado, o jogo é maravilhoso
reviews.reviewText: Vale o preço, um ótimo pen drive extremamente rápido e com alta capacidade para um produto portátil, não avaliei a durabilidade pois estou apenas há 2 semanas com ele
The product is good quality. I use it for my cameras backup and its very fast.

Lo unico malo que tiene esta memoria es el plastico se siente muy fragil , pero por el precio y lamcalidad de a marca es una gran opcion . Las uso para almacenar informacion , y use otra para mi consola playstation classic y funciona sin ningun problema . Si solo quieres una memoria para tu casa officina o consola esta es la buena bonita y barata , pero si quieres una memoria de uso rudo para llevr a todos lados que resista golpes y caidas busca otras opciones mas resistentes .
